slide.title: Opening a Database
slide.blurb: As with any database system the first thing you must do is open a database. Since SQLite is based on files opening a database differs very little from opening a regular file.
slide.example:
<?php
	/* resource sqlite_open(string filename [, int mode [, string &error_message]]) */
	$db = sqlite_open("db.sqlite", 0666, $error) 
		or die("Failed to connect because: ".$error);
	/* opened a connection to memory only database */
?>

list.bullet: PHP file system checks (safe_mode, open_basedir) are performed on the database path.
If the database does not exist it will be created.
The optional mode parameter can be used to open the database in read-only mode.
